results.title: Piaf
results.creator_credit: Guy Casaril, Cy Feuer, Films Feuer and Martin and Martin Productions
results.brief_description: Biographical film adapted from the book “Piaf” by Simone Berteaut about Edith Piaf, the world renowned French torch singer also known as the “sparrow”. Piaf is still much loved and admired today with her unique voice and style being reinterpreted on stage and film across the world. This portrayal includes several of her original recordings including La Vie En Rose. Stars Brigitte Ariel as Piaf with Pascale Christophe, Pierre Vernier, Jacques Duby, Anouk Ferjac, Guy Trejan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Guy Casaril, Cy Feuer, Films Feuer and Martin and Martin Productions

results.title: The Ghost train
results.creator_credit: Walter Forde, Edward Black, Gainsborough Pictures and Gaumont
results.brief_description: Tales of ghosts and things that go bump in the night feature in this British comedy thriller about a phantom train and a group of travellers stranded overnight in the waiting room of a small Cornish junction station. Stars Arthur Askey along with Richard Murdoch, Kathleen Harrison, Peter Murray-Hill, Carole Lynne and Morland Graham. Based on the play by Arnold Ridley.

results.title: The Pajama game
results.creator_credit: George Abbott, Stanley Donen and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A musical comedy about a pajama factory worker and her co-workers fight to get a 7.1/2 cents pay raise that is being fought by their employers. Cast includes Doris Day, John Raitt, Carol Haney and Eddie Foy Jr, with music and lyrics by Richard Adler and Jerry Ross, and choreography by Bob Fosse. Based upon the book “7.1/2 cents” by Richard Bissell and the play “The Pajama game” by George Abbott and Richard Bissell. Screenplay by George Abbott and Richard Bissell.

results.title: Carefree
results.creator_credit: Mark Sandrich, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Fickle Amanda Cooper (Ginger Rogers) has postponed her wedding so often that her fiance sends her to his best friend, a psychoanalyst, (Fred Astaire) for treatment. In spite of hypnosis and assorted other wacky attempts at remedies Amanda falls in love with her psychoanalyst. Cast also includes Ralph Bellamy, Luella Gear, Jack Carson. Lyrics and music by Irving Berlin.

results.title: Cleopatra
results.creator_credit: Cecil B. DeMille, Adolph Zukor and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Cleopatra is illustrative of the conception of historical epic as charade in which the stars are not only cast as famous historical figures but historical figures are cast as stars (Cleopatra as Colbert). What is absent here is De Mille’s characteristic combination of spectacle and morality play. Instead, the spectacle of a sexual extravaganza, (epitomised by the seduction of Mark Antony on the Royal Barge), verges on self parody. This is held in check only by De Mille’s commitment to conventions of realist stage melodrama, (from his formative years in the theatre), allied with a strong pictorial sensibility. Stars Claudette Colbert, Henry Wilcoxon, Warren William. From an adaptation of historical marterial by Bartlett Cormack.

constellations_other.name: Dress to impress
constellations_other.description: In The Great, Peter and Catherine’s costumes during their Dacha visit are designed to demonstrate their unity, as they negotiate with the Swedish royals. Clothes have long been a way to communicate power, particularly in politics.

results.title: Crimson tide
results.creator_credit: Tony Scott, Don Simpson, Jerry Bruckheimer and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Two military men from different eras collide when their submarine is engaged in possible nuclear warfare. Gene Hackman plays an old-school captain, fearsome to his staff and a stickler for rules; Denzel Washington plays Lt. Commander Ron Hunter, a Harvard graduate who believes preventing conflict is also the role of the armed forces. As these two face off over the possibility of war, tensions, egos and threats soar. Cast also includes James Gandolfini and Matt Craven.

results.title: The 13th Warrior = The Thirteenth Warrior
results.creator_credit: John McTiernan, Michael Crichton, Ned Dowd and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in 922 AD, an Arab courtier accompanies a party of Vikings to the barbaric North where he is reluctantly enlisted to help them battle the flesh eating Wendol. Cast includes: Antonios Banderas, Omar Sharif.

results.title: Irene
results.creator_credit: Herbert Wilcox, Imperadio Pictures and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on American playwright James Montgomery’s book of the same name written in 1919, and a remake of the 1926 silent hit, this romantic musical comedy stars Anna Neagle in the lead role of Irene, a poor young Irish girl working in New York and her subsequent involvement with two wealthy men vying for her affection. Stars Ray Milland, Alan Marshal, Roland Young, Billie Burke.

results.title: Julius Caesar
results.brief_description: Film adaptation of Shakespeare’s “Julius Caesar” stars Charlton Heston in the role of Mark Antony and Harold Tasker as Julius Caesar. Cast includes Grosvenor Glenn, Robert Holt, Mary Sefton Darr. Video also contains a collector’s bonus in the form of a 10 minute minidoco on the making of “The Ten Commandments” presented by Cecil B. De Mille.

results.title: The Norman conquests. Part 2. Living together
results.creator_credit: David Susskind, Verity Lambert, Herbert Wise and Thames Television
results.brief_description: Based on Alan Ayckbourn’s West End trilogy “The Norman conquests” and adapted for television, part two of the trilogy, “Living together” sees the irrepressible Norman (Tom Conti) continuing his pursuit of the various women in his family including his sister-in-law, his brother-in-law’s wife and his own wife. The trilogy takes place over a weekend in the family’s country house and features the same six characters in each play. Each story is played out through different eyes but the three plays together form the whole picture. Complex plot but contains some wonderful moments of wit and humour. Stars Richard Briers, Penelope Keith, David Troughton, Fiona Walker, Penelope Wilton.
